required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Three Dose Regimen of Tranexamic Acid in Cardiac Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Three Dose Regimen of Tranexamic Acid on Blood Loss and Allogeneic Transfusions in Cardiac Surgery With Cardiopulmonary Bypass

lead_sponsor.agency: Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences, Fuwai Hospital

clinical_study.source: Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences, Fuwai Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Tranexamic acid is thought to be a promising substitute for aprotinin when the latter has seceded in 2007. Yet the ideal dosage and dosing regimen of tranexamic acid in cardiopulmonary bypass cardiac surgery in Chinese population remains controversial. The current study includes patients receiving valvular replacement and coronary artery bypass surgery. Three dosage regimen of tranexamic acid is delivered and blood loss, transfusions and clinical outcomes are recorded.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of exposure to allogeneic erythrocytes transfusions
primary_outcome.description: Allogeneic RBCs were transfused if the hemoglobin level was less than 6 g/dL during cardiopulmonary bypass, less than 8 g/dL postoperatively, or less than 9 g/dL for elderly people (>70 years).

secondary_outcome.description: Allogeneic RBCs were transfused if the hemoglobin level was less than 6 g/dL during cardiopulmonary bypass, less than 8 g/dL postoperatively, or less than 9 g/dL for elderly people (>70 years).

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate and volume of fresh frozen plasma transfusion
Rate and volume of allogeneic platelet transfusion

secondary_outcome.description: Defined as total volume of chest drainage postoperatively
FIB, FDP, FXI:C, AT-III, D-dimer and TXB2
ET-1, IL-2, IL-6, IL-8, IL-10, TNF-Î±, NE, FN and PGI2

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of stay in ICU and hospital postoperatively

arm_group.description: Tranexamic acid with a loading dose of 30 mg/kg and a maintenance infusion of 20 mg/kg/h
Tranexamic acid with a loading dose of 20 mg/kg and a maintenance infusion of 15 mg/kg/h
Tranexamic acid with a loading dose of 10 mg/kg and a maintenance infusion of 10 mg/kg/h

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Rheumatic or recessive valvular disease patients requiring valvular replacement surgery with cardiopulmonary bypass
- Coronary artery disease patients requiring coronary artery bypass surgery with cardiopulmonary bypass
- Wrriten consent obtained
Exclusion Criteria:
- Non-primary cardiac surgery
- Preoperative liver or renal dysfunction
- Preoperative coagulation disorder
- Allergy
- Pregnancy or lactation
- Disabled in spirit or law
- Fatal conditions such as tumour
